metadata.title: CVE-2023-52760 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: gfs2:Fix slab-use-after-free in gfs2_qd_dealloc In gfs2_put_super(), whetherwithdrawn or not, the quota should be cleaned up by gfs2_quota_cleanup().Otherwise, struct gfs2_sbd will be freed before gfs2_qd_dealloc (rcucallback) has run for all gfs2_quota_data objects, resulting inuse-after-free. Also, gfs2_destroy_threads() and gfs2_quota_cleanup() isalready called by gfs2_make_fs_ro(), so in gfs2_put_super(), after callinggfs2_make_fs_ro(), there is no need to call them again.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-lowlatency - 4.4.0-258.292
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-228-generic - 4.15.0-228.240~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-228-generic - 4.15.0-228.240~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-228-lowlatency - 4.15.0-228.240~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1136-kvm - 4.4.0-1136.146
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1173-aws - 4.4.0-1173.188
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1172-aws - 4.15.0-1172.185~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1180-azure - 4.15.0-1180.195~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1104-fips - 4.4.0-1104.111
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1104-fips - 4.4.0-1104.111
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1104-fips - 4.4.0-1104.111
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1104-fips - 4.4.0-1104.111
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1134.145~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
